intro: Eucodonia verticillata, commonly known as the spiral herb, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Eucodonia verticillata is often used in ornamental gardening for its unique foliage and delicate blooms.
